title: (x) Dunkin Donuts box type - Frankfurter {Geoff}
content:
I’m sure you’ve all seen this.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911200717im_/http:/typophile.com/files/07_2_6542.JPG)

 [‹ (x) font on flash card, similar to ITC Honda - Valiant {Mike F}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911200717/http:/typophile.com/node/28053 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) “Emily & Aaron” script on wedding invitation - Bickham Script {Edward Maddison} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911200717/http:/typophile.com/node/28212 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bergh

comments.content: I think [Frankfurter](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911200717/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=ITC.100337.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=DUNKIN+DONUTS&sampleSize=48) is exactly it. (For perverse reasons, I seem to have a lot of fonts in this style, which used to be called gaspipe or speedball. But when do I ever use them?)

I just fought off the urge to get doughnuts this morning and now the temptation is BACK!!!

ChrisL
People, please think about others before posting identification requests.

Oh I miss Dunkin Donuts.. I went to 6th grade next to a DD in MA... and I loved Saturday Night Live’s skit about the Boston/MA Accent...and the DDs around... I also miss ’Time to Make the Donuts’ star Mr. Valle ... I only remember his last name because of his daughter Ivy Valle who I use to hang out with in NYC.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/93279914@N00/83566158/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911200717/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/93279914@N00/83566158/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/93279914@N00/83566158/")

Oh time to make the Frankfurters... wicked pissa......give me we a cream filled and a Corfee Regullaaa.

I fell for that regular coffee stuff on my first visit nawth. I thought regular meant black, silly me, till they filled it with cream and sugar! That was a pissahw!

ChrisL

black, is plain.  
regular is cream with sugar yes  
light is more cream than regular and you’d hear ’how many soogaas?’

and if you ask for a latte, that’s milk, ya reetaad it’s a ’cafe latte’.
